creator: dietmar.steinbichler@sap.com
text:
Hi,

I was trying to use XSLFHyperlink to create hyperlinks in a PowerPoint file.
However the 3.13 and 3.14 implementation only has setAddress() as method.

According to the Javadoc it should however have methods like


https://poi.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/poi/hslf/usermodel/HSLFHyperlink.html
linkToFirstSlide() and linkToLasttSlide()

Is this a bug or a feature ;-)

Best regards,
Dietmar

creator: apache@gagravarr.org
text: The link you have given is for HSLF and HSLFHyperlink, not XSLF which is what you're trying to use. https://poi.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/poi/xslf/usermodel/XSLFHyperlink.html is the correct docs for XSLFHyperlink

creator: dietmar.steinbichler@sap.com
text:
Hi Nick,

sorry for adding the wrong link. However also your link shows the additional methods that are not available in the distribution.

If I test the Tutorial6 code from this location:
http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/poi/trunk/src/examples/src/org/apache/poi/xslf/usermodel/Tutorial6.java

I am getting an error "The method linkToSlide(...) is undefined" in line 51.

Regards,
Dietmar

creator: kiwiwings@apache.org
text:
(In reply to Dietmar Steinbichler from comment #0)
> Is this a bug or a feature ;-)

It's a feature ... you don't need to worry about hyperlink on the document level anymore, but only call the method on the hyperlink itself.

This was introduced via r1726458
and is valid currently only for the trunk and so also the tutorials are adapted
and don't match the released version.

Andi

creator: dietmar.steinbichler@sap.com
text:
Thanks for clarifying this!

One last question. What would in that case be the proposed solution to navigate to the next slide via Hyperlink?
Could you give me a short code snippet?

Regards,
Dietmar

creator: dietmar.steinbichler@sap.com
text:
Hi Again,

Okay I found now some more information. It seems the convenience functions are brand new and only available in the latest nightly build. Not even in the beta.

So the documentation is newer than the latest distribution.

Which leaves one open question to me:
Is there any way now to connect a Hyperlink to a Shape?
It looks like this is now available but I couldn't find good information how to do this.

Regards,
Dietmar

creator: kiwiwings@apache.org
text:
Look at [1] ... createHyperlink ()

if you have further questions, please use the mailing list!


[1] https://poi.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/poi/sl/usermodel/SimpleShape.html

creator: onealj@apache.org
text:
(In reply to Dietmar Steinbichler from comment #5)
> So the documentation is newer than the latest distribution.

The documentation is updated to reflect the latest code on trunk, and is generally updated on the same commit or a few commits after trunk is updated. So the documentation generally leads beta and final releases, except on release day!
The documentation for any given release is handily packaged with that release itself! (It's in the binary package, or can be regenerated from the source package)
creator: apache@gagravarr.org
